casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Carroll Gene ALEXANDER. No. 408P02-2. Supreme Court of North Carolina. September 16, 2005. C. Gary Triggs, for Carroll Gene Alexander. Patricia A. Duffy, Assistant Attorney General, Alan Martin, Assistant District Attorney, for State of NC.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Defendant on the 15th day of September 2005 for Writ of Supersedeas and Motion for Temporary Stay of the Order of the Court of Appeals in this matter, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 16th day of September 2005."

Upon consideration of the notice of appeal of right G.S. 7A-30(b)(2), filed by Defendant on the 15th day of September 2005 in this matter, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals: the notice of appeal is

"Dismissed Ex Mero Motu by order of the Court in conference, this the 16th day of September 2005."

Upon consideration of the petition filed by Defendant on the 15th day of September 2005 in this matter for a writ of certiorari to review the order of the Superior Court, Alexander County, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the Superior Court of that County:

"Dismissed by order of the Court in conference, this the 16th day of September 2005."
